description: The E-Drive Passport is a data record that summarizes the components, materials and chemical substances or information on repairability, spare parts or professional disposal for an E-Drive. The data comes from all phases of the product life cycle and can be used for various purposes in all these phases (design, production, use, disposal). Structuring environmental data in a standardized, comparable format enables all actors in the value and supply chain to work together towards a circular economy. This data model is based on the new proposed Ecodesign Regulation (ESPR-2022) and the product specific requirements collected from different manufacturers and users of the product.

CompatibleVehicleTypesTrait.description: Constraint for the three possible vehicle types. A selection of multiple is possible.
CompatibleVehicleTypesTrait.pattern: battery-electric vehicle|hybrid-electric vehicle|fuel-cell-electric vehicle|(?:battery-electric vehicle, |hybrid-electric vehicle, |fuel-cell-electric vehicle, )*battery-electric vehicle|hybrid-electric vehicle|fuel-cell-electric vehicle

DateList.description: A list of values in the data type date.

DateCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for values in the data type date.

history.description: The dates of putting the eDrive into service.

lastServiceDate.description: The date of the last service.

compatibleVehicleTypes.description: The vehicle types, in which the eDrive of this passport can be used. Possible selections are "battery-electric vehicle", "hybrid-electric vehicle", "fuel-cell-electric vehicle".

IdentifierCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for identifiers of components in the electrical drive.

Text.description: Describes a Property which contains plain text. This is intended exclusively for human readable strings, not for identifiers, measurement values, etc.

RevolutionsMeasurement.description: Measurement of revolutions per minute as float value.

MillimetreMeasurement.description: Measurement of millimetre as float value.

QuantityValueCharacteristic.description: The quantity value associated with the unit expressed as float.

MassCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for mass measurements of an item.

value.description: The quantity value associated with the unit.

unit.description: The unit of a mass related attribute.

id.description: The unique serial ID of the e-Machine built into the eDrive of this passport; defined and provided by the owner/economic operator of the passport.

permanentMagnetType.description:
The permanent magnet type describes the material composition of the permanent magnet in use. In case of SSM e-Motors, no permanent magnets are used, requiring the input of a default value. Possible selections:
- No permanent magnets used (SSM motor): "None"
- AlNiCo: "Aluminum-Nickel-Cobalt"
- Ceramic: "Ceramic"
- Ferrite: "Ferrite"
- Flexible: "Flexible Rubber"
- SmCo: "Samarium Cobalt"
- NdFeB: "Neodymium Iron Boron"

ratedSpeed.description: Rated speed determined by the electronics and measured in RPM, limited through software or physical limits (e.g. maximum power).

statorDiameter.description: Diameter of the E-Machine stator, measured in millimetres.

technology.description: The type of the e-machine built into the eDrive. Possible values are "ASM" (Asynchronous motor), "PSM" (Permanently excited synchronous motor) and "ESM" (Electrically-excited synchronous motor). This should not  be confused with an electrical machine integrated in a transmission.

weight.description: Net weight, component weight without packaging, of the electrical machine, which is built into the eDrive.

CubicDecimetreMeasurement.description: Measurement of cubic decimetre as float value.

Timestamp.description: Describes a Property which contains the date and time with an optional timezone.

BarMeasurement.description: Measurement of the pressure in bar as float value.

time.description: Measuring timestamp, when the oil pressure during the usage of the eDrive was measured last.

value.description: Oil pressure to date during the usage of the eDrive, as measured through the oil pump, measured in bar.

CelsiusMeasurement.description: Measurement in celsius as float value.

coolingTopology.description: General cooling topology, which can be either one of the types: "air-cooled", "water-cooled" or "oil-cooled".

oilCapacityEdrive.description: The defined oil volume in the eDrive, measured in cubic decimetres. In case of a combined oil circuit for both the eDrive and the built-in transmission, the value must be identical to the oil capacity value of the transmission.

oilTypeEdrive.description: The type of the oil for the eDrive defined by the manufacturer. In case of a combined oil circuit for both the eDrive and the built-in transmission, the value must be identical to the oil type value of the transmission.

minimumOilPressure.description: Minimum oil pressure to date during the usage of the eDrive, as measured through the oil pump, measured in bar.

maximumOilPressure.description: Maximum oil pressure to date during the usage of the eDrive, as measured through the oil pump, measured in bar.

oilModule.description: Flag indicating the availability or absence of an oil module. An oil module is an umbrella term for devices that are manipulating the oil flow and the temperature in the product and incorporate cooler, pump, valves (pressure regulation valve).

maximumOilTemperature.description: The maximum oil temperature to safely operate the eDrive, measured in celsius on the oil temperature sensor. Please note the oil temperature can vary in other positions within the lubrication circuit.

AmpereMeasurement.description: Measurement of ampere as float value.

inverterCurrent.description: Electric current flowing through the inverter, measured in ampere.

maximumPhaseCurrent.description: The maximum allowable current to pass through the phases, measured in ampere.

softwareVersion.description: Indicates the software version of the inverter.

VoltMeasurement.description: Measurement in volt as float value.

KilowattMeasurement.description: Measurement in kilowatt as float value.

SecondsMeasurement.description: Measurement in seconds as integer value.

value.description: The maximum value in kilowatts for a specified time period.

period.description: Specified time period measurement in seconds.

ECER85.description: Maximum power in kilowatts, measured according to the ECER85 regulatory requirements.

MaximumRegeneratedPowerCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for maximum regenerated power values.

maxValue.description: The maximum value in kilowatts for a specified time period.

maxPeriod.description: Specified time period measurement in seconds.

maximum.description: The maximum output power in kilowatts for a specified time period.

continuous.description: The output power in kilowatts that can be delivered continuously.

continuousRegenerated.description: The amount of power, which can be regenerated continuously, within the bounds of normal operation, in kilowatts.

maxRegenerated.description: The maximum possible value that can be regenerated at a given time in kilowatts.

NewtonMetreMeasurement.description: Measurement in newton metre as decimal value.

value.description: Measured torque value in newton metre.

period.description: Specified time period measurement in seconds.

maximum.description: The maximum torque the system delivers over a specific measurement time period.

continuous.description: The torque that can theoretically be delivered constantly without a time limit.

maxAxle.description: Maximum motor torque multiplied by the gear ratio.

SystemCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for performance and system values.

voltage.description: The characterizing voltage level in the vehicle in volts, to which the battery and electric drive are adjusted to.

gearRatio.description: Gear ratio calculated by dividing the angular or rotational speed of the output shaft by the angular speed of the input shaft. It can also be calculated by dividing the total driving gear’s teeth by the total driven gear’s teeth.

StringList.description: A list with the data types string.

oilCapacity.description: The defined oil volume in the transmission in cubic decimeters.

oilType.description: The type of the oil for the transmission defined by the manufacturer of the transmission.

transmissionId.description: Transmission ID of the transmission i.e. serial number allowing for unequivocal identification of the transmission.

gearboxStructure.description: Short description of the gearbox design, e.g. layshaft or planetary, depending on the technical design of the car.

oil.description: The oil used for the transmission.

HeaderTrait.description: Constraint for a maximum of 100 characters.

DocumentationEntity.description: Entity for a document with a header, type and content.

content.description: The content of the document e.g a link.

contentType.description: The type of content which can be expected in the "content" property. Examples are a link, restricted link, pdf, excel, etc.

header.description: The header as a short description of the document with a maximum of 100 characters.

ElectricDriveDocumentsCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for specific documents of the electric drive.

technicalDismantlingInstructions.description: Document containing information and instructions, including steps, diagrams and illustrations of removing or replacing the eDrive or dismantling it.

requiredToolsForDismantling.description: Document containing information and instructions for required tools or technologies pertaining to the removal, replacement or dismantling of the eDrive.

SpecificCharacteristic.description: The Characteristic to describe product specific parameters of the electric drive.

generalInformation.description: General information to the eDrive system, including additional information in comparison to the identification category such as the service history and compatible vehicle types.

eMachine.description: Data of the e-Machine built into the eDrive, including information E-Machine model and technology (type), and the permanent magnet types / materials.

coolingAndLubricants.description: Information about the used lubricants and coolants, including liquid specifications and built-in technical lubricant systems.

inverter.description: Inverter related data, that could be used in case of replacing or updating an inverter.

systemAndPerformance.description: System and Performance information of the entire eDrive system.

transmission.description: Information about the transmission built into the eDrive, including technical data.

electricDriveDocuments.description: Documents pertaining to the removal, replacement, disassembly or dismantling of the entire eDrive.

StatusEnumeration.description: The current status of the product passport declared through either: draft, approved, invalid or expired.

DateTrait.description: Constraint fo a timestamp in the format (yyyy-mm-dd).

BpnlTrait.description: The provided regular expression ensures that the BPNL is composed of prefix 'BPNL', 10 digits and two alphanumeric letters.

UuidV4Trait.description: The provided regular expression ensures that the UUID is composed of five groups of characters separated by hyphens, in the form 8-4-4-4-12 for a total of 36 characters (32 hexadecimal characters and 4 hyphens), optionally prefixed by "urn:uuid:" to make it an IRI.

MetadataCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for the passport metadata of the digital product passport.

version.description:
The current version of the product passport. The possibility of modification/ updating the product passport needs to include versioning of the dataset. This attribute is an internal versioning from the passport issuer. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Article 8:
(1) [...] The information in the product passport shall be accurate, complete, and up to date.

status.description: The current status of the product passport declared through either: draft, approved, invalid or expired.

expirationDate.description:
The timestamp in the format (yyyy-mm-dd) for the product passport until when it is available or a comment describing this period. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Article 8:
(2) (h) the period during which the product passport is to remain available, which shall correspond to at least the expected lifetime of a specific product.

issueDate.description: The timestamp in the format (yyyy-mm-dd) since when the product passport is available.

economicOperatorId.description:
The identification of the owner/economic operator of the passport. Proposed, according to ISO 15459, is the CIN (company identification code). Other identification numbers like the tax identification number, value added tax identification number, commercial register number and the like are also valid entries. In the Catena-X network, the BPNL is used for the identification of companies and the information stored like contact information and addresses. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Annex III:
(k) the [...] unique operator identifier code of the economic operator established in the Union responsible for carrying out the tasks set out in Article 4 of Regulation (EU) 2019/1020, or Article 15 of Regulation (EU) on general product safety, or similar tasks pursuant to other EU legislation applicable to the product.

passportIdentifier.description: The identifier of the product passport, which is an uuidv4.

predecessor.description:
Identification of the preceding product passport. If there is no preceding passport, input a dummy value. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Article 8:
(2)(g) [...] Any new product passport shall be linked to the product passport or passports of the original product whenever appropriate.

backupReference.description:
A reference to the data backup of the passport. This mandatory attribute will be further defined in the future. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Annex III:
(kb) the reference of the certified independent third-party product passport service provider hosting the back-up copy of the product passport.
Article 10 also mentions:
(c) the data included in the product passport shall be stored by the economic operator responsible for its creation or by certified independent third-party product passport service providers authorised to act on their behalf.

registrationIdentifier.description:
Identifier in the respective registry. This will be further defined in the future. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 in Article 12:
By [2 years from entering into force of this Regulation], the Commission shall set up and manage a digital registry ("the registry") storing in a secure manner at least the unique product identifier, the unique operator identifier, the unique facility identifiers. In case of products intended to be placed under the customs procedure 'release for free circulation', the registry shall also store the product commodity code. The registry shall also store the batteries' unique identifiers referred to in Article 77(3) of Regulation (EU) 2023/1542.

KeyTrait.description: Constraint that ensures that the standard keys and custom key prefixes can be used.

KeyValueList.description: A list of key value pairs for local identifiers, which are composed of a key and a corresponding value.

key.description: The key of a local identifier.

LocalIdentifierCharacteristic.description: A single serialized part may have multiple attributes, that uniquely identify a that part in a specific dataspace (e.g. the manufacturer`s dataspace)

KeyTrait0.description: Constraint that ensures that the predefined keys are used.

KeyValueList0.description: A list of key value pairs for local identifiers, which are composed of a key and a corresponding value.

key.description: The key of a local identifier.

LocalIdentifierCharacteristic0.description: A batch may have multiple attributes, which uniquely identify that batch in a specific dataspace(e.g. the manufacturer`s dataspace)

PartIdCharacteristic.description: The part ID is a multi-character string, usually assigned by an ERP system.

PartNameCharacteristic.description: Part name in string format from the respective system in the value chain.

manufacturerPartId.description: Part ID as assigned by the manufacturer of the part. The part ID identifies the part in the manufacturer`s dataspace. The part ID references a specific version of a part. The version number must be included in the part ID if it is available. The part ID does not reference a specific instance of a part and must not be confused with the serial number.

nameAtManufacturer.description: Name of the part as assigned by the manufacturer.

CodeEnumeration.description: Enumeration for GTIN, hash, DID, ISBN, TARIC or other.

CodeEntity.description: Code entity with code key and value.

value.description: The code value for the identification of the product in regard to the chosen code name.

description.description: Description of the specific code. This attribute can be particularly used, if "other" as code key is used.

DataCarrierCharacteristic.description: Data Carrier Characteristic for the product.

carrierType.description:
The type of data carrier such as a QR code on the product. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Article 8:
(2) (b) the types of data carrier to be used.

carrierLayout.description:
The positioning of data carrier on the product. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Article 8:
(2) (c) the layout in which the data carrier shall be presented and its positioning.

ClassificationStandardCharacteristic.description: Identified classification standards that align to the Catena-X needs.

ClassificationIDCharacteristic.description: It can be numeric or a string, depending on the chosen classification standard.

ClassificationEntity.description: Encapsulates data related to the classification of the part.

classificationStandard.description: Identified classification standards that align to the Catena-X needs.

classificationID.description: The classification ID of the part type according to the corresponding standard definition mentioned in the key value pair.

classificationDescription.description: Optional property describing the classification standard.

ClassificationCharacteristic.description: Classification characteristic enabling a set of further properties.

serial.description:
Identifier for a serial part if available. This is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Recital (27):
[...] an 'item' usually means a single unit of a model.

batch.description:
Identifier for a batch part if available. Identifier for a serial part if available. This is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Recital (27):
[...] a 'batch' usually means a subset of a specific model composed of all products produced in a specific manufacturing plant at a specific moment in time [...].

type.description:
Identifier on the level of a part model or type. Identifier for a serial part if available. This is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Recital (27):
[...] A 'model' usually means a version of a product of which all units share the same technical characteristics relevant for the ecodesign requirements and the same model identifier [...].

classification.description: Property describing the classification of a part.

BpnaTrait.description: The provided regular expression ensures that the BPNA is composed of prefix 'BPNA', 10 digits and two alphanumeric letters.

FacilityEntity.description: The entity for a facility with the BPNA identifier.

manufacturingDate.description: The timestamp in the format (yyyy-mm-dd) of the manufacturing date as the final step in production process (e.g. final quality check, ready-for-shipment event).

EoriTrait.description: Constraint with a pattern which ensures that the EORI number starts with two alphanumeric characters, followed by two alphabetic characters, and ends with 2 to 15 alphanumeric characters.

ImporterCharacteristic.description: Characteristic with information regarding the importer.

eori.description:
An economic operator established in the customs territory of the Union needs, for customs purposes, an EORI number. EORI stands for economic operators registration and identification number. In this case, the importer's EORI must be provided. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Annex III:
(j) information related to the importer, including the information referred to in Article 23(3) and its EORI number.

id.description:
The importer of the product, if different from the owner of the passport. In the Catena-X network, the BPNL is used for the identification of companies and the information stored for this like contact information and addresses.
This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024  Annex III:
(j) information related to the importer, including the information referred to in Article 23(3) and its EORI number;
Article 23 states:
(3) Importers shall, for products covered by a delegated act adopted pursuant to Article 4, indicate their name, registered trade name or registered trade mark and the postal address and electronic means of communication, where they can be contacted:  (a) on the public part of the product passport, when applicable, and
(b) on the product or, where this is not possible, on the packaging, or in a document accompanying the product.

importer.description:
Information regarding the importer of the product, if different from the owner of the passport. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Annex III:
(j) information related to the importer, including the information referred to in Article 23(3) and its EORI number;
Article 23 states:
(3) Importers shall, for products covered by a delegated act adopted pursuant to Article 4, indicate their name, registered trade name or registered trade mark and the postal address and electronic means of communication, where they can be contacted:  (a) on the public part of the product passport, when applicable, and
(b) on the product or, where this is not possible, on the packaging, or in a document accompanying the product.

applicable.description: Check whether the connected attributes are applicable to the product. If it is not applicable (false), dummy data can be delivered.

import.description: Importer details such as the identification.

SourcesEntity.description: Entity for a possible spare part sources.

id.description: The identifier of a spare part producer of the product. In the Catena-X network, the BPNL is used for the identification of companies and the information stored for this like contact information and addresses.

SourcesList.description: List of possible spare part sources.

PartsEntity.description: Possible spare parts of the product with identifiers and names.

manufacturerPartId.description: Part ID as assigned by the manufacturer of the part. The part ID identifies the part in the manufacturer`s dataspace. The part ID references a specific version of a part. The version number must be included in the part ID if it is available. The part ID does not reference a specific instance of a part and must not be confused with the serial number.

nameAtManufacturer.description: Name of the part as assigned by the manufacturer.

PartList.description: A list of possible spare parts of the product.

SparePart.description: Characteristic describing sources and spare parts.

sparePart.description: Possible spare parts of the product.

HandlingCharacteristic.description: Characteristic to describe aspects which are connected with the handling of the product.

spareParts.description: The list of spare parts available for the product from various suppliers.

applicable.description: Check whether the connected attributes are applicable to the product. If it is not applicable (false), dummy data can be delivered.

LifeEnumeration.description: Enumeration with the possible units day, month, cycle, year and runningOrOperatingHour.

LifeValueCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for the life span value as an integer.

LifeTypeEnumeration.description: Enumeration with the values guaranteed lifetime, technical lifetime and mean time between failures.

LifespanEntity.description: Entity for the lifespan of a product with type, unit and value.

unit.description: The unit of the respective lifespan expressed through the possible units day, month, cycle, year and runningOrOperatingHour.

value.description: The value as an integer for the respective lifespan.

key.description:
The type of lifespan represented with the values guaranteed lifetime, technical lifetime and mean time between failures. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 ANNEX I:
(a) durability and reliability of the product or its components as expressed through the product's guaranteed lifetime, technical lifetime [or] mean time between failures [...].

LifespanList.description: List of different life spans of a product.

LinearUnitEnumeration.description: The unit of a linear attribute that may be used for height, width, length and diameter.

LinearCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for linear measurements of an item.

value.description: The quantity value associated with the unit.

unit.description: The unit of a linear attribute.

VolumeCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for volume measurements of an item.

value.description: The quantity value associated with the unit.

unit.description: The unit of a volume related attribute.

PhysicalDimensionCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for physical dimensions with linear, mass and capacity attributes.

width.description: The width of the item measured in a specific linear unit which can be declared in the corresponding unit attribute.

length.description: The length of the item measured in a specific linear unit which can be declared in the corresponding unit attribute.

diameter.description: The diameter of the item, if applicable, measured in a specific linear unit which can be declared in the corresponding unit attribute.

height.description: The height of the item measured in a specific linear unit which can be declared in the corresponding unit attribute.

PhysicalStateEnumeration.description: Enumeration with the values solid, liquid, gas and plasma.

ProductCharacteristics.description: Defines a set of specific characteristics of a product.

lifespan.description:
The type of lifespan represented with the values guaranteed lifetime, technical lifetime and mean time between failures. Both can be described through the attributes: type, which defines the type such as guaranteed lifetime or technical lifetime, the unit for the lifetime, and the value represented by an integer. These attributes are mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 ANNEX I:
(a) durability and reliability of the product or its components as expressed through the products guaranteed lifetime, technical lifetime [or] mean time between failures [...].

physicalState.description: The physical state of the item. There are four states of matter solid, liquid, gas and plasma which can be chosen from an enumeration.

generalPerformanceClass.description:
The performance class of the product. This attribute is mentioned ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Article 7:
4. When establishing the information requirements referred to in paragraph 2, point (b), point (i), the Commission shall, as appropriate in view of the specificity of the product group, determine classes of performance. Classes of performance may be based on single parameters, on aggregated scores, in absolute terms or in any other form that enables potential customers to choose the best performing products. Those classes of performance shall correspond to significant improvements in performance levels. Where classes of performance are based on parameters in relation to which performance requirements are established, they shall use as the minimum level the minimum performance required at the time when the classes of performance start to apply.
Definition:
'class of performance': means a range of performance levels in relation to one or more product parameters referred to in Annex I, based on a common methodology for the product or product group, ordered into successive steps to allow for product differentiation.

placedOnMarket.description: The timestamp in the format (yyyy-mm-dd) with or without time zone when the product was put in the market.

ConcentrationEnumeration.description: Enumeration of possible units of concentration with percent, volume percent, parts per thousand, parts per million, parts per billion and parts per trillion.

category.description:
The hazard category of the substance of concern. Defined in Article 2 of Regulation (EC) No 1272/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 December 2008 on classification, labelling and packaging of substances and mixtures, amending and repealing Directives 67/548/EEC and 1999/45/EC, and amending Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006:
2. 'hazard category' means the division of criteria within each hazard class, specifying hazard severity.

class.description:
The hazard class of the substance of concern. Defined in Article 2 of Regulation (EC) No 1272/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 December 2008 on classification, labelling and packaging of substances and mixtures, amending and repealing Directives 67/548/EEC and 1999/45/EC, and amending Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006:
1. 'hazard class' means the nature of the physical, health or environmental hazard.

statement.description:
The hazard statement of the substance of concern. Defined in Article 2 of Regulation (EC) No 1272/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 December 2008 on classification, labelling and packaging of substances and mixtures, amending and repealing Directives 67/548/EEC and 1999/45/EC, and amending Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006:
5. 'hazard statement' means a phrase assigned to a hazard class and category that describes the nature of the hazards of a hazardous substance or mixture, including, where appropriate, the degree of hazard.

RangeEntity.description: Entity for the concentration range with two values, the highest and the lowest of the concentration range.

min.description:
The minimum concentration of the substance of concern at the level of the product. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Article 7:
(5) (c) [...] concentration range of the substances of concern, at the level of the product [...].

max.description:
The maximum concentration of the substance of concern at the level of the product. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Article 7:
(5) (c) the concentration, maximum concentration or concentration range of the substances of concern, at the level of the product [...].

RangeCharacteristic.description: Range characteristic with two values, the highest and the lowest of the concentration range. Only providing the maximum range is also possible.

ListTypeEnumerationName.description: Enumeration of different systems and organizations related to the identification and classification of chemical substances in the field of chemistry. The enumeration values are IUPAC, EC or CAS.

NameCharacteristic.description: Name Characteristic for the definition of the name.

name.description: The name, in accordance with the specification in the attribute for the list type, which is present in the product.

type.description: The type of list used for the identification of the substances. Preference is given to the IUPAC name for the substances of concern. Selected can be for example IUPAC, EC or CAS.

ListTypeEnumerationId.description: Enumeration of different systems and organizations related to the identification and classification of chemical substances in the field of chemistry. The enumeration values are EC or CAS.

MaterialIdEntity.description: Id Entity with identifier and list type.

id.description: The substance identification, in accordance with the specification in the attribute for the list type.

type.description: The type of list used for the identification of the substances. Selected can be for example CAS or EC.

MaterialIdList.description: List of ids for the identification.

SubstanceEntity.description: Information regarding substances of concern in the product.

location.description:
The location of the substances of concern within the product. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Article 7:
(5) (b) the location of the substances of concern within the product.

unit.description: The unit of concentration chosen from an enumeration: mass percent, volume percent, parts per thousand, parts per million, parts per billion and  parts per trillion.

concentration.description:
Concentration of the material at the level of the product. This attribute is specially mentioned for substances of concern mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Article 7:
(5) (c) the concentration, maximum concentration or concentration range of the substances of concern, at the level of the product [...].
Other substances are mentioned for the purporse of recycling in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Annex I:
(d) design for recycling, ease and quality of recycling as expressed through: use of easily recyclable materials, safe, easy and non-destructive access to recyclable components and materials or components and materials containing hazardous substances and material composition and homogeneity, possibility for high-purity sorting, number of materials and components used, use of standard components, use of component and material coding standards for the identification of components and materials, number and complexity of processes and tools needed, ease of nondestructive disassembly and re-assembly, conditions for access to product data, conditions for access to or use of hardware and software needed.

exemption.description:
Exemptions to the substance of concern. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Article 7:
(5) (c) provide duly justified exemptions for substances of concern or information elements from the information requirements referred to in the first subparagraph based on the technical feasibility or relevance of tracking substances of concern, the existence of analytical methods to detect and quantify them, the need to protect confidential business information or in other duly justified cases. Substances of concern within the meaning of Article 2(28), point a), shall not be exempted if they are present in products, their relevant components or spare parts in a concentration above 0,1 % weight by weight.

concentrationRange.description:
The concentration range for the substance of concern. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Article 7:
(5) (c) [...] concentration range of the substances of concern, at the level of the product [...].

id.description: The material identification, in accordance with the specification in the attribute list type.

SubstanceList.description: Characteristic for a list of substances of concern.

SubstanceOfConcernCharacteristic.description: Substance of concern Characteristic of the product.

applicable.description: Check whether the connected attributes are applicable to the product. If it is not applicable (false), dummy data can be delivered.

PercentageTrait.description: Range constraint for a positive percentage value.

MaterialEntity.description: Information regarding recycled and/or renewable materials in the product.

recycled.description:
The share of the material, which is recovered recycled content from the product. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Annex I:
(h) use or content of recycled materials and recovery of materials, including critical raw materials;

renewable.description:
The share of the material, which is from a renewable resource that can be replenished. Renewable resources are those that can be reproduced by physical, chemical, or mechanical processes. These are the kind of resources that can be regenerated throughout time. Forest wood, for example, can be grown through reforestation. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Annex I:
(ha) use or content of sustainable renewable materials;

unit.description: The unit of concentration chosen from an enumeration: mass percent, volume percent, parts per thousand, parts per million, parts per billion and  parts per trillion.

id.description: The material identification, in accordance with the specification in the attribute list type.

concentration.description:
Concentration of the material at the level of the product. This attribute is specially mentioned for substances of concern mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Article 7:
(5) (c) the concentration, maximum concentration or concentration range of the substances of concern, at the level of the product [...].
Other substances are mentioned for the purporse of recycling in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Annex I:
(d) design for recycling, ease and quality of recycling as expressed through: use of easily recyclable materials, safe, easy and non-destructive access to recyclable components and materials or components and materials containing hazardous substances and material composition and homogeneity, possibility for high-purity sorting, number of materials and components used, use of standard components, use of component and material coding standards for the identification of components and materials, number and complexity of processes and tools needed, ease of nondestructive disassembly and re-assembly, conditions for access to product data, conditions for access to or use of hardware and software needed.

MaterialList.description: A list of different materials in the product.

MaterialCharacteristic.description: Material Characteristic with information on the materials.

applicable.description: Check whether the connected attributes are applicable to the product. If it is not applicable (false), dummy data can be delivered.

chemicalMaterial.description: Information on different materials in the product.

substancesOfConcern.description:
Information regarding substances of concern in the product. The ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 defines:
(52) 'hazardous substance' means a substance classified as hazardous pursuant to Article 3 of Regulation (EC) No 1272/2008.

materialComposition.description: Material composition of the product with information on recycled and renewable materials.

StateEnumeration.description: Enumeration defined as original, repurposed, re-used, remanufactured or waste.

CategoryEnumeration.description: Enumeration of the 19 impact categories in accordance to EN15804+A2.
enum: Climate Change Biogenic Removals and Emissions
Climate Change Land Use and Land Use Change

FootprintEntity.description: Footprint Entity for the carbon and environmental footprint with the total value, unit, impact category type, lifecycle, rulebook, declaration, performance class and the facility.

rulebook.description: The applied rulebook for the environmental footprint of the product.

lifecycle.description: The lifecycle stage, to which the environmental footprint corresponds. These could be for example "raw material acquisition and pre-processing", "main product production", "distribution" or "end of life and recycling".

unit.description: The unit of measurement of the environmental impact category. For each impact category a specific unit is used. If an aggregation is used, utilize the normalization and weighting methods used in the referenced rulebook.

performanceClass.description: The performance classification of the footprint.

manufacturingPlant.description: The manufacturing plant of the footprint in the specific lifecycle phase.

declaration.description: The footprint declaration in the format of a link

FootprintList.description: Footprint List for the environmental footprint.

ProductFootprintCharacteristic.description: The Product Footprint Characteristic with sustainability information.

environmental.description:
The environmental footprint of the product. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Annex I:
The following parameters shall, as appropriate, and where necessary supplemented by others, be used, individually or combined, as a basis for improving the product aspects referred to in Article 5(1):
(l) the environmental footprint of the product, expressed as a quantification, in accordance with the applicable delegated act, of a product's life cycle environmental impacts, whether in relation to one or more environmental impact categories or an aggregated set of impact categories.
and Article 7:
(2)(b)(i) information on the performance of the product in relation to one or more of the product parameters referred to in Annex I, including a scoring of reparability or durability, carbon footprint or environmental footprint;
and defined by Article 2:
(23) 'environmental footprint' means a quantification of product environmental impacts throughout its life cycle, whether in relation to a single environmental impact category or an aggregated set of impact categories based on the Product Environmental Footprint method or other scientific methods developed by international organisations and widely tested in collaboration with different industry sectors and adopted or implemented by the Commission in other Union legislation;
(24) 'Product Environmental Footprint method' means the life cycle assessment method to quantify the environmental impacts of products established by Recommendation (EU) 2021/2279.

carbon.description:
The carbon footprint of the product. This is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Annex I:
The following parameters shall, as appropriate, and where necessary supplemented by others, be used, individually or combined, as a basis for improving the product aspects referred to in Article 5(1):
(m) the carbon footprint of the product;
and Article 7:
(2)(b)(i) information on the performance of the product in relation to one or more of the product parameters referred to in Annex I, including a scoring of reparability or durability, carbon footprint or environmental footprint;
and defined by Article 2:
(25) 'carbon footprint' means the sum of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and GHG removals in a product system, expressed as CO2 equivalents and based on a life cycle assessment using the single impact category of climate change.

material.description:
The material footprint of the product. This is mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Annex I:
(ma) the material footprint of the product;
and defined by Article 2:
(25a) 'material footprint' refers to the total amount of raw materials extracted to meet final consumption demands.

SustainabilityCharacteristic.description: Characteristic which describes relevant information for the sustainability of the product.

status.description:
The status of the product (original, repurposed, re-used, remanufactured or waste) to indicated, whether it is a used product. This attribute is mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 Annex I:
(j) incorporation of used components.

reparabilityScore.description:
The reparability score. This attribute is mentioned ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Article 7:
(b) as appropriate, also require products to be accompanied by:
(i) information on the performance of the product in relation to one or more of the product parameters referred to in Annex I, including a scoring of reparability or durability [...].

durabilityScore.description:
The durability score. This attribute is mentioned ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 Article 7:
(b) as appropriate, also require products to be accompanied by:
(i) information on the performance of the product in relation to one or more of the product parameters referred to in Annex I, including a scoring of reparability or durability [...].

SourceCategoryEnumeration.description: The types of sources that can be linked in a digital product passport can vary depending on the nature of the product and the information that needs to be included. This is an enumeration of possible sources.

DocumentEntity.description: Document entity with header, content, category and type.

content.description: The content of the document e.g a link.

category.description:
The category in which the document can be sorted. These are mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 ANNEX III:
(e) compliance documentation and information required under this Regulation or other Union law applicable to the product, such as the declaration of conformity, technical documentation or conformity certificates;
ANNEX IV states additional information regarding the content of the technical documentation
Further information on documents are mentioned in the proposal from March 30th, 2022 ANNEX III:
(f) user manuals, instructions, warnings or safety information, as required by other Union legislation applicable to the product.
Additionally requirements are mentioned in Article 21:
(7) Manufacturers shall ensure that that a product covered by a delegated act adopted pursuant to Article 4 is accompanied by instructions that enable consumers and other end-users to safely assemble, install, operate, store, maintain, repair and dispose of the product in a language that can be easily understood by consumers and other end-users, as determined by the Member State concerned. Such instructions shall be clear, understandable and legible and include at least the information specified in the delegated acts adopted pursuant to Article 4 and pursuant to Article 7(2)(b), point (ii).
Article 7 states additionally:
(2) (b) (ii) information for consumers and other end-users on how to install, use, maintain and repair the product in order to minimize its impact on the environment and to ensure optimum durability, as well as on how to return or dispose of the product at end-of-life;
(2) (b) (iii) information for treatment facilities on disassembly, recycling, or disposal at end-of-life;
(2) (b) (iv) other information that may influence the way the product is handled by parties other than the manufacturer in order to improve performance in relation to product parameters referred to in Annex I.
(5) (d) relevant instructions for the safe use of the product.

type.description: The type of content which can be expected in the "content" property. Examples are a link, restricted link, pdf, excel, etc.

header.description: The header as a short description of the document with a maximum of 100 characters.

UnspecificCharacteristic.description: Characteristic for the product unspecific parameters.

metadata.description: Metadata of the product passport. These are mentioned in the ESPR proposal from March 30th, 2022 and some changed by the provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024.

identification.description:
Identification information of the product, especially identifiers and codes. These are mentioned in the ESPR provisional agreement from January 9th, 2024 ANNEX III:
(b) the unique product identifier at the level indicated in the applicable delegated act adopted pursuant to Article 4.
Additionally in Article 9 regarding general requirements for the product passport is stated that:
A product passport shall meet the following conditions:
(a) it shall be connected through a data carrier to a persistent unique product identifier;
(e) the information included in the product passport shall refer to the product model, batch, or item as specified in the delegated act adopted pursuant to Article 4.
Article 2 Definitions: 
(31) 'unique product identifier' means a unique string of characters for the identification of products that also enables a web link to the product passport;
Recital (27): A 'model' usually means a version of a product of which all units share the same technical characteristics relevant for the ecodesign requirements and the same model identifier, a 'batch' usually means a subset of a specific model composed of all products produced in a specific manufacturing plant at a specific moment in time and an 'item' usually means a single unit of a model.

handling.description: Properties connected with the handling of the product.

characteristics.description: Defines specific characteristics of a product.

materials.description: Properties which are relevant for the materials of the product.

specific.description: Product specific parameters of the electric drive.

unspecific.description: The product unspecific parameters. These are defined by the Digital Product Passport proposal from the ESPR. The main basis is provided by the document "Proposal for a REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL establishing a framework for setting ecodesign requirements for sustainable products and repealing Directive 2009/125/EC" from March 30th, 2022. The latest version of the document was the provisional agreement between the EU Council and the Parliament from January 9th, 2024.
